046
047/**
048 * Entry point for Juneau microservice that implements a REST interface using Jetty on a single port.
049 *
050 * <h5 class='topic'>Jetty Server Details</h5>
051 *
052 * The Jetty server is created by the {@link #createServer()} method and started with the {@link #startServer()} method.
053 * These methods can be overridden to provided customized behavior.
054 *
055 * <h5 class='topic'>Defining REST Resources</h5>
056 *
057 * Top-level REST resources are defined in the <c>jetty.xml</c> file as normal servlets.
058 *
059 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
060 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauMicroserviceJettyBasics">juneau-microservice-jetty Basics</a>
061 * </ul>
062 */
063public class JettyMicroservice extends Microservice {
064
065   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
066   // Static
067   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068
069   private static final String KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER = "ServletContextHandler";
070
071    private static volatile JettyMicroservice INSTANCE;
072
073   private static void setInstance(JettyMicroservice m) {
074      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
075         INSTANCE = m;
076      }
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Returns the Microservice instance.
081    * <p>
082    * This method only works if there's only one Microservice instance in a JVM.
083    * Otherwise, it's just overwritten by the last instantiated microservice.
084    *
085    * @return The Microservice instance, or <jk>null</jk> if there isn't one.
086    */
087   public static JettyMicroservice getInstance() {
088      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
089         return INSTANCE;
090      }
091   }
092
093   /**
094    * Entry-point method.
095    *
096    * @param args Command line arguments.
097    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
098    */
099   public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
100      JettyMicroservice
101         .create()
102         .args(args)
103         .build()
104         .start()
105         .startConsole()
106         .join();
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Creates a new microservice builder.
111    *
112    * @return A new microservice builder.
113    */
114   public static Builder create() {
115      return new Builder();
116   }
117
118   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
119   // Builder
120   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
121
122   /**
123    * Builder class.
124    */
125   public static class Builder extends Microservice.Builder {
126
127      String jettyXml;
128      int[] ports;
129      Boolean jettyXmlResolveVars;
130      Map<String,Servlet> servlets = map();
131      Map<String,Object> servletAttributes = map();
132      JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
133      JettyServerFactory factory;
134
135      /**
136       * Constructor.
137       */
138      protected Builder() {}
139
140      /**
141       * Copy constructor.
142       *
143       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy settings from.
144       */
145      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
146         super(copyFrom);
147         this.jettyXml = copyFrom.jettyXml;
148         this.ports = copyFrom.ports;
149         this.jettyXmlResolveVars = copyFrom.jettyXmlResolveVars;
150         this.servlets = copyOf(copyFrom.servlets);
151         this.servletAttributes = copyOf(copyFrom.servletAttributes);
152         this.listener = copyFrom.listener;
153      }
154
155      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
156      public Builder copy() {
157         return new Builder(this);
158      }
159
160        /**
161         * Specifies the contents or location of the <c>jetty.xml</c> file used by the Jetty server.
162         *
163         * <p>
164         * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
165         * <ul class='spaced-list'>
166         *   <li>
167         *         <c>Jetty/config</c> setting in the config file.
168         *         <c>Jetty-Config</c> setting in the manifest file.
169         * </ul>
170         *
171         * <p>
172         * By default, we look for the <c>jetty.xml</c> file in the following locations:
173         * <ul class='spaced-list'>
174         *     <li><c>jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
175         *     <li><c>files/jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
176         *     <li><c>/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
177         *     <li><c>/files/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
178         * </ul>
179         *
180         * @param jettyXml
181         *     The contents or location of the file.
182         *     <br>Can be any of the following:
183         *     <ul>
184         *      <li>{@link String} - Relative path to file on file system or classpath.
185         *      <li>{@link File} - File on file system.
186         *      <li>{@link Path} - Path on file system.
187         *      <li>{@link InputStream} - Raw contents as <c>UTF-8</c> encoded stream.
188         *      <li>{@link Reader} - Raw contents.
189         *     </ul>
190         *
191         * @param resolveVars
192         *     If <jk>true</jk>, SVL variables in the file will automatically be resolved.
193         * @return This object.
194         * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
195         */
196        public Builder jettyXml(Object jettyXml, boolean resolveVars) throws IOException {
197            if (jettyXml instanceof String)
198                this.jettyXml = read(resolveFile(jettyXml.toString()));
199            else if (jettyXml instanceof File file)
200                this.jettyXml = read(file);
201            else if (jettyXml instanceof Path path)
202                this.jettyXml = read(path);
203            else if (jettyXml instanceof InputStream inputStream)
204                this.jettyXml = read(inputStream);
205            else if (jettyXml instanceof Reader reader)
206                this.jettyXml = read(reader);
207            else
208                throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid object type passed to jettyXml(Object): {0}", className(jettyXml));
209            this.jettyXmlResolveVars = resolveVars;
210            return this;
211        }
212
213      /**
214       * Specifies the ports to use for the web server.
215       *
216       * <p>
217       * You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  <js>'0'</js> indicates to try a random port.
218       * The resulting available port gets set as the system property <js>"availablePort"</js> which can be referenced in the
219       * <c>jetty.xml</c> file as <js>"$S{availablePort}"</js> (assuming resolveVars is enabled).
220       *
221       * <p>
222       * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
223       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
224       *    <li>
225       *       <c>Jetty/port</c> setting in the config file.
226       *    <li>
227       *       <c>Jetty-Port</c> setting in the manifest file.
228       *    <li>
229       *       <c>8000</c>
230       * </ul>
231       *
232       * Jetty/port", mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}
233       * @param ports The ports to use for the web server.
234       * @return This object.
235       */
236      public Builder ports(int...ports) {
237         this.ports = ports;
238         return this;
239      }
240
241      /**
242       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
243       *
244       * <p>
245       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
246       * <br>The path is pulled from the {@link Rest#path()} annotation.
247       *
248       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
249       * @return This object.
250       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
251       */
252      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends RestServlet> c) throws ExecutableException {
253         RestServlet rs;
254         try {
255            rs = c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
256         } catch (Exception e) {
257            throw new ExecutableException(e);
258         }
259         return servlet(rs, '/' + rs.getPath());
260      }
261
262      /**
263       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
264       *
265       * <p>
266       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
267       *
268       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
269       * @param path The servlet path spec.
270       * @return This object.
271       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
272       */
273      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends Servlet> c, String path) throws ExecutableException {
274         try {
275            return servlet(c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance(), path);
276         } catch (Exception e) {
277            throw new ExecutableException(e);
278         }
279      }
280
281      /**
282       * Adds a servlet instance to the servlet container.
283       *
284       * @param servlet The servlet to add to the servlet container.
285       * @param path The servlet path spec.
286       * @return This object.
287       */
288      public Builder servlet(Servlet servlet, String path) {
289         servlets.put(path, servlet);
290         return this;
291      }
292
293      /**
294       * Adds a set of servlets to the servlet container.
295       *
296       * @param servlets
297       *    A map of servlets to add to the servlet container.
298       *    <br>Keys are path specs for the servlet.
299       * @return This object.
300       */
301      public Builder servlets(Map<String,Servlet> servlets) {
302         if (servlets != null)
303            this.servlets.putAll(servlets);
304         return this;
305      }
306
307      /**
308       * Adds a servlet attribute to the servlet container.
309       *
310       * @param name The attribute name.
311       * @param value The attribute value.
312       * @return This object.
313       */
314      public Builder servletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
315         this.servletAttributes.put(name, value);
316         return this;
317      }
318
319      /**
320       * Adds a set of servlet attributes to the servlet container.
321       *
322       * @param values The map of attributes.
323       * @return This object.
324       */
325      public Builder servletAttribute(Map<String,Object> values) {
326         if (values != null)
327            this.servletAttributes.putAll(values);
328         return this;
329      }
330
331      /**
332       * Specifies the factory to use for creating the Jetty {@link Server} instance.
333       *
334       * <p>
335       * If not specified, uses {@link BasicJettyServerFactory}.
336       *
337       * @param value The new value for this property.
338       * @return This object.
339       */
340      public Builder jettyServerFactory(JettyServerFactory value) {
341         this.factory = value;
342         return this;
343      }
344

404         super.consoleCommands(consoleCommands);

410         super.console(consoleReader, consoleWriter);

417         super.vars(vars);
418         return this;
419      }

423         super.varBean(c, value);
424         return this;
425      }

429         super.workingDir(path);

435         super.workingDir(path);
436         return this;

439      /**
440       * Registers an event listener for this microservice.
441       *
442       * @param listener An event listener for this microservice.
443       * @return This object.
444       */
445      public Builder listener(JettyMicroserviceListener listener) {
446         super.listener(listener);
447         this.listener = listener;
448         return this;
449      }

451
452   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
453   // Instance
454   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
455
456   final Messages messages = Messages.of(JettyMicroservice.class);
457
458   private final Builder builder;
459   final JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
460   private final JettyServerFactory factory;
461
462   volatile Server server;
463
464   /**
465    * Constructor.
466    *
467    * @param builder The constructor arguments.
468    * @throws IOException Problem occurred reading file.
469    * @throws ParseException Malformed content found in config file.
470    */
471   protected JettyMicroservice(Builder builder) throws ParseException, IOException {
472      super(builder);
473      setInstance(this);
474      this.builder = builder.copy();
475      this.listener = builder.listener != null ? builder.listener : new BasicJettyMicroserviceListener();
476      this.factory = builder.factory != null ? builder.factory : new BasicJettyServerFactory();
477   }
478
479   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
480   // Methods implemented on Microservice API
481   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
482
483   @Override /* Microservice */
484   public synchronized JettyMicroservice init() throws ParseException, IOException {
485      super.init();
486      return this;
487   }
488
489   @Override /* Microservice */
490   public synchronized JettyMicroservice startConsole() throws Exception {
491      super.startConsole();
492      return this;
493   }
494
495   @Override /* Microservice */
496   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stopConsole() throws Exception {
497      super.stopConsole();
498      return this;
499   }
500
501   @Override /* Microservice */
502   public synchronized JettyMicroservice start() throws Exception {
503      super.start();
504      createServer();
505      startServer();
506      return this;
507   }
508
509   @Override /* Microservice */
510   public JettyMicroservice join() throws Exception {
511      server.join();
512      return this;
513   }
514
515   @Override /* Microservice */
516   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stop() throws Exception {
517      final Logger logger = getLogger();
518      final Messages mb2 = messages;
519      Thread t = new Thread("JettyMicroserviceStop") {
520         @Override /* Thread */
521         public void run() {
522            try {
523               if (server == null || server.isStopping() || server.isStopped())
524                  return;
525               listener.onStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
526               out(mb2, "StoppingServer");
527               server.stop();
528               out(mb2, "ServerStopped");
529               listener.onPostStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
530            } catch (Exception e) {
531               logger.log(Level.WARNING, e.getLocalizedMessage(), e);
532            }
533         }
534      };
535      t.start();
536      try {
537         t.join();
538      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
539         e.printStackTrace();
540      }
541      super.stop();
542
543      return this;
544   }
545
546   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
547   // JettyMicroservice API methods.
548   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
549
550   /**
551    * Returns the port that this microservice started up on.
552    * <p>
553    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/port</c> value in the
554    * Jetty configuration.
555    *
556    * @return The port that this microservice started up on.
557    */
558   public int getPort() {
559      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
560         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
561            return ((ServerConnector)c).getPort();
562      throw new IllegalStateException("Could not locate ServerConnector in Jetty server.");
563   }
564
565   /**
566    * Returns the context path that this microservice is using.
567    * <p>
568    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Handlers[ServletContextHandler]/contextPath</c> value
569    * in the Jetty configuration.
570    *
571    * @return The context path that this microservice is using.
572    */
573    public String getContextPath() {
574        return getServletContextHandler().getContextPath();
575//        for (Handler h : getServer().getHandlers()) {
576//            if (h instanceof HandlerCollection)
577//                for (org.eclipse.jetty.ee9.nested.Handler h2 : ((HandlerCollection) h).getChildHandlers())
578//                    if (h2 instanceof ServletContextHandler)
579//                        return ((ServletContextHandler) h2).getContextPath();
580//            if (h instanceof ServletContextHandler)
581//                return ((ServletContextHandler) h).getContextPath();
582//        }
583//        throw new IllegalStateException("Could not locate ServletContextHandler in Jetty server.");
584    }
585
586   /**
587    * Returns whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
588    * <p>
589    * The value is determined by looking for the existence of an SSL Connection Factorie by looking for the
590    * <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/ConnectionFactories[SslConnectionFactory]</c> value in the Jetty
591    * configuration.
592    *
593    * @return Whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
594    */
595   public String getProtocol() {
596      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
597         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
598            for (ConnectionFactory cf : ((ServerConnector)c).getConnectionFactories())
599               if (cf instanceof SslConnectionFactory)
600                  return "https";
601      return "http";
602   }
603
604   /**
605    * Returns the hostname of this microservice.
606    * <p>
607    * Simply uses <c>InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName()</c>.
608    *
609    * @return The hostname of this microservice.
610    */
611   public String getHostName() {
612      String hostname = "localhost";
613      try {
614         hostname = InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName();
615      } catch (UnknownHostException e) {}
616      return hostname;
617   }
618
619   /**
620    * Returns the URI where this microservice is listening on.
621    *
622    * @return The URI where this microservice is listening on.
623    */
624   public URI getURI() {
625      String cp = getContextPath();
626      try {
627         return new URI(getProtocol(), null, getHostName(), getPort(), "/".equals(cp) ? null : cp, null, null);
628      } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
629         throw asRuntimeException(e);
630      }
631   }
632
633   /**
634    * Method used to create (but not start) an instance of a Jetty server.
635    *
636    * <p>
637    * Subclasses can override this method to customize the Jetty server before it is started.
638    *
639    * <p>
640    * The default implementation is configured by the following values in the config file
641    * if a jetty.xml is not specified via a <c>REST/jettyXml</c> setting:
642    * <p class='bini'>
643    *    <cc>#================================================================================
644    *    # Jetty settings
645    *    #================================================================================</cc>
646    *    <cs>[Jetty]</cs>
647    *
648    *    <cc># Path of the jetty.xml file used to configure the Jetty server.</cc>
649    *    <ck>config</ck> = jetty.xml
650    *
651    *    <cc># Resolve Juneau variables in the jetty.xml file.</cc>
652    *    <ck>resolveVars</ck> = true
653    *
654    *    <cc># Port to use for the jetty server.
655    *    # You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  '0' indicates to try a random port.
656    *    # The resulting available port gets set as the system property "availablePort" which can be referenced in the
657    *    # jetty.xml file as "$S{availablePort}" (assuming resolveVars is enabled).</cc>
658    *    <ck>port</ck> = 10000,0,0,0
659    * </p>
660    *
661    * @return The newly-created server.
662    * @throws ParseException Configuration file contains malformed input.
663    * @throws IOException File could not be read.
664    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
665    */
666   public Server createServer() throws ParseException, IOException, ExecutableException {
667      listener.onCreateServer(this);
668
669      Config cf = getConfig();
670      JsonMap mf = getManifest();
671      VarResolver vr = getVarResolver();
672
673      int[] ports = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.ports, cf.get("Jetty/port").as(int[].class).orElseGet(()->mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}, int[].class)));
674      int availablePort = findOpenPort(ports);
675
676      if (System.getProperty("availablePort") == null)
677         System.setProperty("availablePort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
678
679      String jettyXml = builder.jettyXml;
680      String jettyConfig = cf.get("Jetty/config").orElse(mf.getString("Jetty-Config", "jetty.xml"));
681      boolean resolveVars = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.jettyXmlResolveVars, cf.get("Jetty/resolveVars").asBoolean().orElse(false));
682
683      if (jettyXml == null)
684         jettyXml = IOUtils.loadSystemResourceAsString("jetty.xml", ".", "files");
685      if (jettyXml == null)
686         throw new BasicRuntimeException("jetty.xml file ''{0}'' was not found on the file system or classpath.", jettyConfig);
687
688      if (resolveVars)
689         jettyXml = vr.resolve(jettyXml);
690
691      getLogger().info(jettyXml);
692
693      try {
694         server = factory.create(jettyXml);
695      } catch (Exception e2) {
696         throw new ExecutableException(e2);
697      }
698
699      for (String s : cf.get("Jetty/servlets").asStringArray().orElse(new String[0])) {
700         try {
701            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(s));
702            if (c.isChildOf(RestServlet.class)) {
703               RestServlet rs = (RestServlet)c.newInstance();
704               addServlet(rs, rs.getPath());
705            } else {
706               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servlets.  Must be a subclass of RestServlet: {0}", s);
707            }
708         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
709            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
710         }
711      }
712
713      cf.get("Jetty/servletMap").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach((k,v) -> {
714         try {
715            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(v.toString()));
716            if (c.isChildOf(Servlet.class)) {
717               Servlet rs = (Servlet)c.newInstance();
718               addServlet(rs, k);
719            } else {
720               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servletMap.  Must be a subclass of Servlet: {0}", v);
721            }
722         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
723            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
724         }
725      });
726
727      cf.get("Jetty/servletAttributes").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach(this::addServletAttribute);
728
729      builder.servlets.forEach((k,v) -> addServlet(v, k));
730
731      builder.servletAttributes.forEach(this::addServletAttribute);
732
733      if (System.getProperty("juneau.serverPort") == null)
734         System.setProperty("juneau.serverPort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
735
736      return server;
737   }
738
739   /**
740    * Calls {@link Server#destroy()} on the underlying Jetty server if it exists.
741    *
742    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
743    */
744   public void destroyServer() throws Exception {
745      if (server != null)
746         server.destroy();
747      server = null;
748   }
749
750   /**
751    * Adds an arbitrary servlet to this microservice.
752    *
753    * @param servlet The servlet instance.
754    * @param pathSpec The context path of the servlet.
755    * @return This object.
756    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
757    */
758   public JettyMicroservice addServlet(Servlet servlet, String pathSpec) {
759      ServletHolder sh = new ServletHolder(servlet);
760      if (pathSpec != null && ! pathSpec.endsWith("/*"))
761         pathSpec = trimTrailingSlashes(pathSpec) + "/*";
762      getServletContextHandler().addServlet(sh, pathSpec);
763      return this;
764   }
765
766   /**
767    * Finds and returns the servlet context handler defined in the Jetty container.
768    *
769    * @return The servlet context handler.
770    * @throws RuntimeException if context handler is not defined.
771    */
772   public ServletContextHandler getServletContextHandler() {
773      Object obj = getServer().getAttribute(KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER);
774      if (obj instanceof ServletContextHandler) {
775         return (ServletContextHandler)obj;
776      }
777      throw new IllegalStateException("Servlet context handler not found in jetty server or at attribute '" + KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER + "'");
778   }
779
780   /**
781    * Adds a servlet attribute to the Jetty server.
782    *
783    * @param name The server attribute name.
784    * @param value The context path of the servlet.
785    * @return This object.
786    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
787    */
788   public JettyMicroservice addServletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
789      getServer().setAttribute(name, value);
790      return this;
791   }
792
793   /**
794    * Returns the underlying Jetty server.
795    *
796    * @return The underlying Jetty server, or <jk>null</jk> if {@link #createServer()} has not yet been called.
797    */
798   public Server getServer() {
799      return Objects.requireNonNull(server, "Server not found.  createServer() must be called first.");
800   }
801
802   /**
803    * Method used to start the Jetty server created by {@link #createServer()}.
804    *
805    * <p>
806    * Subclasses can override this method to customize server startup.
807    *
808    * @return The port that this server started on.
809    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
810    */
811   protected int startServer() throws Exception {
812      listener.onStartServer(this);
813      server.start();
814      out(messages, "ServerStarted", getPort());
815      listener.onPostStartServer(this);
816      return getPort();
817   }
818
819   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
820   // Utility methods
821   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
822
823   private static int findOpenPort(int[] ports) {
824      for (int port : ports) {
825         // If port is 0, try a random port between ports[0] and 32767.
826         if (port == 0)
827            port = new Random().nextInt(32767 - ports[0] + 1) + ports[0];
828         try (ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(port)) {
829            return port;
830         } catch (IOException e) {}
831      }
832      return 0;
833   }
834}
